titleStmt.title: G. W. Baker et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4722

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
March the 22nd 1864
Hamilton Ky
His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

We the undersigned Petitioners Respectfully Ask you to Remit the fine assessed against Vincent Ross at the last ^August^ term of the gallatin circuit court Amt $20.00 ^cts^ him and 4 others were indited for play^ing^ cards the others appeared and gott clear Judgment went By default circumstan^ces^ was so that Ross could not attend the court as he doubtless would and have come clear as there was no proof against him

signed By
G. W. Baker
James. W. Miller
G. G. Miller Esqr
L. Rich
W. H. Baker Rept
C. B. Johnson

Petition of Vincent Ross
Gallatin Cir Ct
vs
Vincent Ross
Remit
Remitted 18th
May 64
Ross
